verses.text: 捐得樂意的人為　神喜愛關於供應聖徒的事，我本來沒有寫信給你們的必要，

words.note: Connects a verb with an adverbial complement.
Often used to describe a cheerful or willing attitude.
Refers to the Christian God; the space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to believers, literally 'holy disciples'.

words.definition: originally, as a matter of course

verses.text: 因為我知道你們有這個心願。我對馬其頓人稱讚你們，說：「亞該亞人去年已經預備好了。」你們的熱心就激勵了許多的人。

words.note: People from Macedonia.
People from Achaia, a Roman province in Greece.

verses.text: 我派了那幾位弟兄前來，為了要使我們在這事上對你們的稱讚不至落空，好讓你們可以照著我所說的準備妥當，

words.note: Refers to fellow believers, not necessarily blood relatives.

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of

words.note: Used as a postposition to mean 'on this matter' or 'in this respect'.

words.definition: not come to, not result in

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase from a verb, e.g., 'what I said'.

verses.text: 免得一旦馬其頓人和我一同來到的時候，見你們還沒有準備好，我們就因為這樣信任你們而感到羞愧，你們就更不用說了。

words.definition: once, in case, in the event that

words.note: People from Macedonia.
Idiomatic expression meaning 'it goes without saying'.

verses.text: 因此，我認為必須勸那幾位弟兄先到你們那裡去，使你們事先籌足從前所答應的捐款。那麼，你們這樣的準備，就是出於樂意的，不是勉強的。

words.note: Refers to fellow believers, literally 'holy disciples'.
Forms a nominal phrase from a verb, e.g., 'what was promised'.
Here, used as a noun meaning 'willingness'.

verses.text: 還有，少種的少收，多種的多收。

words.note: Verb-object compound: 'sow little'
Implies 'those who sow sparingly'
Verb-object compound: 'reap little'
Verb-object compound: 'sow much'
Implies 'those who sow generously'
Verb-object compound: 'reap much'

verses.text: 各人要照著心裡所決定的捐輸，不要為難，不必勉強，因為捐得樂意的人，是　神所喜愛的。

words.note: Used to form a nominalized phrase, e.g., 'that which is decided'
A more formal or literary term for donating
Lit. 'to cause difficulty for oneself'
Connects a verb to a descriptive complement
Forms the nominal phrase 'the one who donates willingly'
Reverential space indicates 'God'
Often indicates a passive construction: 'that which is desired by God'

verses.text: 神能把各樣的恩惠多多地加給你們，使你們凡事常常充足，多作各樣的善事。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, indicating disposal or effect
Reduplication of '多' emphasizes abundance
More formal or literary usage than '所有的事情'

verses.text: 如經上所說：「他廣施錢財，賙濟窮人；他的仁義，存到永遠。」

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts for generous giving

words.definition: give relief to, help the needy
words.note: An older, more formal term often used for charity or aiding the poor
A key concept in both Confucianism and biblical ethics

verses.text: 但那賜種子給撒種的，又賜食物給人吃的　神，必定把種子加倍地供給你們，也必增添你們的義果。

words.note: Formal verb often used for gifts from a superior or divine being
Verb-object compound: 'scatter seed'
Nominalizes the preceding phrase 'the one who sows seed'
Nominalizes the preceding phrase 'food for people to eat'
Reverential space indicates 'God'
A theological term referring to the results of righteous living

verses.text: 你們既然凡事富裕，就可以慷慨地捐輸，使眾人藉著我們，對　神生出感謝的心。
因為這供應的事，不僅補足了聖徒的缺乏，也使許多人對　神感謝的心格外增多。
眾聖徒因為你們承認和服從了基督的福音，並且慷慨地捐輸給他們和眾人，藉著你們在這供應的事上所得的憑據，就把榮耀歸給　神。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'

verses.text: 因著　神在你們身上的厚恩，他們就為你們禱告，切切地想念你們。

words.note: Reduplication of '切' for emphasis.

verses.text: 感謝　神，他的恩賜難以形容。
